byline.contributor: Samuel Kpavouvou contributed reporting from Kpove and Djagblé, Togo.

abstract: Most common form of treatment for those suffering from mental illness in Togo are makeshift psychiatric camps where sufferers are chained to concrete blocks or trees; Togo is representative of West Africa in general dearth of services for mentally ill; issue of how to improve services for mentally ill has drawn renewed focus in wake of United Nations development goal that makes mental health services priority in developing world (Series: Shackled Minds and Bodies).
lead_paragraph: In parts of West Africa, religious retreats set up camps for people with mental illnesses, where patients are frequently shackled and prayer is often the only treatment.

headline.main: The Chains of Mental Illness in West Africa
headline.print_headline: The Chains of Mental Illness Across West Africa
